BdkBinWgtList.rdl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // Holds 6 BdkBinWgt objects, one for each combination of the basic 
00002 // operators (I, R, E_12 and their unique products).
00003 // It also sets the correct coefficients (weights) based on its 
00004 // isospin operator
00005 
00006 #ifndef BDKBINWGTLIST
00007 #define BDKBINWGTLIST
00008 
00009 #include "BToDKTo3piK/BdkBinWgt.hh"
00010 #include "BToDKTo3piK/BdkIsoOp.hh"
00011 
00012 
00013 class BdkBinWgtList {
00014 public:
00015   BdkBinWgtList(int op = BdkIsoOp::P32);
00016 
00017 
00018   // Tell the list which bin to use for which basic operation.
00019   void setI(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00020   void setR(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00021   void setRR(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00022   void setE(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00023   void setER(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00024   void setERR(const BdkTriBin & bin);
00025 
00026   
00027   BdkIsoOp::Op op() const {return _op;}
00028   const BdkBinWgt & i() const {return _i;}
00029   const BdkBinWgt & r() const {return _r;}
00030   const BdkBinWgt & rr() const {return _rr;}
00031   const BdkBinWgt & e() const {return _e;}
00032   const BdkBinWgt & er() const {return _er;}
00033   const BdkBinWgt & err() const {return _err;}
00034 
00035   // A way to access the binWgt with an integer:
00036   const BdkBinWgt & binWgt(int symOp) const;
00037 
00038   // The binWgt given a bin reference. This is useful for finding
00039   // the reverse weight, which BdkBinning::calcEVs() needs in order
00040   // to calculate the error matrix:
00041   const BdkBinWgt * binWgt(const BdkTriBin & bin) const;
00042 
00043 
00044 private:
00045   BdkIsoOp::Op _op;
00046

00048   BdkBinWgt _r;
00049   BdkBinWgt _rr;
00050   BdkBinWgt _e;
00051   BdkBinWgt _er;
00052   BdkBinWgt _err;
